MetaEnum.description:
Enumeration for the Attribute Direction.

Structure Elements:

input : Set direction for the given measurable attributes as input

Output : Set direction for the given measurable attributes as output

unuse : Unuse the given measurable attribues

automatic :
In context of Analysis Request
* If the measurable attribute is input, set as output.
* If the measurable attribute is output, set as input.
* If the measurable attribute is not used, set as input.

In context of Study
* Set the measurable attribute direction based on the direction in the parent Analysis Request.
MetaEnum.name: AttributeDirection

MetaEnum.description:

Structure Elements:
syncAttr : Synchronize the given measurable attributes.
publishAttr : Publish the given measurable attributes.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: this operation does not support adding elements to Analysis Request, please use operation manageAnalysisRequests.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of AddElementsToARInput structure.

Operation.description:
This operation adds specified objects that need to be validated to the Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract). Trace Links of the specified type are created between the Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) and the specified Components to be validated.

Trace Link creation rules are mentioned below:

1. If a Component (Awb0Element) and the Context are specified, in-context Trace Link is created.
2. If a Component (Awb0Element) is specified but the Context is not specified, the Item Revision corresponding to the Component is used to create the Trace Link.
Operation.name: addElementsToAnalysisRequest
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned in the ServiceData:
188009: The Analysis Request Package is invalid, because the specified quantity is invalid for the Teamcenter business object.
188011: The object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it has already been added to it.
188016: The object cannot be added to the Analysis Reques, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
Operation.useCase:
Use case 1: Add a Component in a Product for validation from the Analysis Request's Domain. The Component can be at any level in the Product.
An in-context Trace Link is created between the Component (Awb0Element) and the Analysis Request. The Product is the context in which the Trace Link is created.

Use case 2: Add a Product for validation from the Validation Contract's Domain
A Tracelink is created between the Product's ItemRevision and the Analysis Request.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: this operation does not support adding elements to Analysis Request, please use operation manageAnalysisRequests.

ParameterInfo.description: This structure contains all information required to add objects to Validation Contract.

Operation.description:
Objects that need to be validated must be added to Validation Contracts. This operation adds specified objects that need to be validated to the Valiation Contract. It does this by creating tracelinks of the specified type between the Validation Contract Revision and the specified Components to be validated.
Tracelink creation rules are mentioned below:

1.    If a Component (Awb0Element) and the Context are specified, in-context tracelink is created.
2.    If a Component (Awb0Element) is specified but the Context is not specified, the Item Revision corresponding to the Component is used to created the tracelink.

The objects will be added to sections specified in the "view" group. The sections in the "view" group are specified in the Contract Definition that is attached to the Validation Contract.
Operation.name: addObjectsForValidation
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned in the ServiceData:
35003: If the input Trace Link type is invalid.
35006: If the input Validation Contract is invalid.
35007: If the input object to the added to the Validaiton Contract is invalid.
184007: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified Trace Link type is not (Crt0ValidationLink).
184008: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the section name is empty.
184009: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the component and the context are the same.
184010: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the context of the component does not belong to the Analysis Request's domain.
184011: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it exceeds the quantity of allowed objects for the specified section. The quantity of objects allowed for the section is specified in the Analysis definition.
184012: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified section does not exist in the Analysis definition.
184015: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it is already added to it.
184016: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
184017: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is released.
184018: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is checked out by another user.
Operation.useCase:
Use case 1: Add a Component in a Product for validation from the Validation Contract's Domain. The Component can be at any level in the Product.
An in-context tracelink is created between the Component (Awb0Element) and the Validation Contract. The Product is the context in which the tracelink is created.

Use case 2: Add a Product for validation from the Validation Contract's Domain
A tracelink is created between the Product's Item Revision and the Validation Contract.

Operation.description:
This operation retrieves the information about objects added to Validation Contract (Crt0VldnContractRevision) for validation activity. The below details are retrieved.

1.    Objects added to Validation Contract (Crt0VldnContractRevision) for validation activity.
2.    Complete information of the "view" group as specified in the Contract definition (Crt0VCDefnRevision) that is attached to the Validation Contract (Crt0VldnContractRevision).
3.    Crt0ValidationLink tracelinks that were created when objects were added to the Validation Contract (Crt0VldnContractRevision).
Operation.name: getObjectsAddedForValidation
Operation.returnDescription:
Information about the objects added to validation contracts, the sections where the objects have been added and the tracelinks are returned.

The following partial errors may be returned:
184013: If the Analysis definition details cannot be retrieved, because no definition is attached to the Analysis Request.

ParameterInfo.description: Selected Crt0VldnContractRevision object. Result and chart will be retrived for this object.
A list of TestResultData structure containing information about Crt1VRContentProxy objects.
A list of TestResultData structure containing information about Crt0VldnContractRevision.

A map (string, list of strings) of detailed request information:
“ScopeOfResult”: “All”     The complete contents results are returned.
“Delta” Only the input proxy results are returned.
“RequestedChartDataTypes”- The types of chart data to be populated by this operation ( “Requirement”, “Part”, “Functionality”, “IAV0TestCase”, “IAV0TestRequest”, “CAEAnalysis”, and “CAEModel” )

Operation.description: This operation retrieves the test results of the provided input objects. Input object can be Crt0VldnContractRevision or it can be Crt1VRContentProxy objects. This operation also returns the number of pass, fail and no results status for objects in given Crt0VldnContractRevision. This information can be used for summary of Crt0VldnContractRevision’s content results. If preference AWC_Rollup_Result_Enable is true, then this operation will return rolled-up results otherwise it will be individual object’s result.
Operation.name: getResultAndChartData
Operation.returnDescription:
The results of Crt1VRContentProxy and Crt0VldnContractRevision objects. Structure also has the information about the total pass/fail and no results content objects in Crt0VldnContractRevision. The following partial errors may be returned:

184034 : The input object is not a valid Crt0VldnContractRevision or Crt1VRContentProxy.
184025 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the input scope, is not supported.
184035 : The input result value is not supported. Supported values are no result, pass and fail.
184036 : The input result information value is not supported. Supported values are overridden and rollup.
Operation.useCase:
Use Case 1:
Crt0VldnContractRevision object is a test package. It has requirements, test cases, systems, functions as its content. Each content can have individual test result, or it can have dependent results. User wants to take an overview of Crt0VldnContractRevision’s content test results.
Use Case 2:
User may want to group the content result by content type.
Use Case 3:
User may want to get rolled-up results of content, which will help to understand the first place of failure.
Use Case 4:
When User overrides the results of content, charts and the dependent content results should get updated after save.

ParameterInfo.description: The Verification Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision) or Study (Crt0StudyRevision) or Run (Crt0RunRevision) and the scope of information that must be retrieved.

Operation.description:
This service operation gets information of the input Verification Requests (Crt0VldnContractRevision), Study (Crt0StudyRevision) or Run (Crt0RunRevision), which is a sub type of Verification Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision).

The following information can be retrieved:
a. Input objects (Awb0Element, WorkspaceObject, Att0ParamProject) that are associated with Verification Request.
b. Results for verification which includes Pass/Fail status and reports.
c. Input and output parameters (Att0MeasurableAttribute).
d. Children studies and Run Information (Crt0StudyRevision, Crt0RunRevision) of a Verification Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision).
Operation.name: getVerificationRequestInfo
Operation.returnDescription:
Information about the input Verification Request is returned. The amount of information retrieved depends on the scope specified in the input to the operation. The Verification Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision), Studies (Crt0StudyRevision), Runs (Crt0RunRevision), Added Objects (Awb0Element, WorkspaceObject, Att0ParamProject), parameter details, result for verification which includes Pass/Fail status and reports. Any failures will be returned with the client id mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors :
    • 184022 : The input object is not a valid Analysis Request or Study.
    • 184025 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the input scope, is not supported.
Operation.useCase:
• User may want to retrieve Verification Request added objects.
    • User may want to retrieve Input/Output parameters of Verification Request.
    • User may want to retrieve Study and Run Information of Verification Request.

ParameterInfo.description: A list of ManageAnalysisRequestInput structure.
Preference for managing Analysis Request

Operation.description: This operation manages the content for the given Analysis Request objects.
Operation.name: manageAnalysisRequests
Operation.returnDescription:
Constains the content change for the given Analysis Request objects. Any failures will be returned with the client id mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors:
    • 188011: The object cannot be added to the Analysis Request because it has already been added to it.
    • 188016: The current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
    • 188020: Cannot add the Interface to the Analysis Request, because the parent object was not added to the Analysis Request.
Operation.useCase:
Use case 1: Add system model occurrences to the Analysis Request
For each system model occurrence, the system creates the Crt0ValidationLink between Analysis Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • If the system model occurrence contains the Measurable Attributes, the system assigns these Measurable Attributes to the Analysis Request with the default direction “Input”.
    • If the system model occurrence contains the Port(s), the system addes the Interface Defintions on each Port to the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “diagramAction” is not empty, the system addes the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “useClosureRule” is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Analysis Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Analysis Request.


Use case 2: Remove system model occurrences from the Analysis Request
For each system model occurrence, the system deletes the Crt0ValidatoinLink between Analysis Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • If the system model occurrence contains the measurable attributes, the system un-assigns these attributes from the Analysis Request.
    • If the system model occurrence contains the port(s), the system removes Interface Defintions on each port from the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “diagramAction” is not empty, the system removes the given occurrence from the associated diagram data in the Analysis Request.
    • Skip the flag “useClosureRule”.


Use case 3: Add Interface occurrence to the Analysis Request
For each Interface occurrence, the system queries the parent system model occurrence. If the parent system model occurrence is not added to the Analysis Request, capture the partical error and continue to proceed the next Interface occurrence.
    • If the Interface contains the Interface Definitions, the system adds each Interface Definitions to the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “diagramAction” is not empty, the system addes the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “useClosureRule” is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Analysis Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Analysis Request.


Use case 4: Remove Interface occurrence from the Analysis Request
For each Interface occurrence, the system queries the parent system model occurrence. If the parent system model occurrence is not added to the Analysis Request, capture the partical error and continue to proceed the next Interface occurrence.
    • If the Interface contains the Interface Definitions, the system removes each Interface Definitions from the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “diagramAction” is not empty, the system addes the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Analysis Request.
    • If the flag “useClosureRule” is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Analysis Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Analysis Request.


Use case 5: Add Interface Definitions on the port to the Analysis Request
The system creates the Crt0GDERef to represent the assigned Interface Definition in the Analysis Request.
    • If the Interface Definition contains the Meaurable Attributes, the system assigns these Meaurable Attributes to the Analysis Request. The default attribute direction needs to align to the Interface Definition direction if set. Otherwise, the parent Port direction.
    • Skip the flag “diagramAction”
    • Skip the flag “useClosureRule”


Use case 6: Remove Interface Definitions on the port from the Analysis Request
The system deletes the Crt0GDERef which represents the assigned Interface Definition in the Analysis Request.
    • If the Interface Definition contains the Meaurable Attributes, the system un-assigns these Meaurable Attributes from the Analysis Request.
    • Skip the flag “diagramAction”
    • Skip the flag “useClosureRule”

ParameterInfo.description: A list of ManageVerificationRequestInput structure.
Preference for managing Verification Request.

Operation.description: This operation manages the content for the given Verification Request object.
Operation.name: manageVerificationRequests
Operation.returnDescription:
Constains the content change for the given Verification Request. Any failures will be returned with the client id mapped to error message in the ServiceData list of partial errors:
    • 188011: The object cannot be added to the Verification Request because it has already been added to it.
    • 188016: The current user does not have write privileges to the Verification Request.
    • 188020: Cannot add the Interface to the Verification Request, because the parent object was not added to the Verification Request.
    • 188031: Cannot create new occurrence parent object information is not provided.
    • 188033: An invalid object has been provided in the objectToAdd input argument. Please provide a valid value.
    • 188034: An invalid object has been provided in the objectToAddContext input argument. Please provide a valid value.
    • 188035: An invalid object has been provided in the objectToAddParent input argument. Please provide a valid value.
    • 188036: An invalid value has been provided in the elementAction input argument. Valid values are ‘Child’ and ‘Sibiling’.
    • 188037: An invalid value has been provided in the manageAction input argument. Please provide a valid value.
    • 188038: An invalid object has been provided in the parameter input argument. Please provide a valid value.
    • 188039: An invalid value has been provided in the seedObjects input argument. Please provide a valid value.
Operation.useCase:
Use case 1: Add occurrences to the Verification Request
For each occurrence, the system creates the Crt0ValidationLink between Verification Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • If the occurrence contains the Measurable Attributes, the system assigns these Measurable Attributes to the Verification Request with the default direction “Input”.
    • If the occurrence contains the Port(s), the system addes the Interface Defintions on each Port to the Verification Request.
    • If the diagramAction in ManageVerificationRequestPref is not empty, the system adds the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Verification Request.
    • If the useClosureRule in ManageVerificationRequestPref is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Verification Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Verification Request.


Use case 2: Remove occurrences from the Verification Request
For each occurrence, the system deletes the Crt0ValidatoinLink between Verification Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • If the occurrence contains the measurable attributes, the system un-assigns these attributes from the Verification Request.
    • If the occurrence contains the port(s), the system removes Interface Defintions on each port from the Verification Request.
    • If diagramAction in ManageVerificationRequestPref is not empty, the system removes the given occurrence from the associated diagram data in the Verification Request.
    • Skips the flag useClosureRule in ManageVerificationRequestPref.


Use case 3: Add WorkspaceObject to the Verification Request
For each WorkspaceObject, the system creates the Crt0ValidationLink between Verification Request (primary) and WorkspaceObject (secondary).
    • If the WorkspaceObject contains the Measurable Attributes, the system assigns these Measurable Attributes to the Verification Request with the default direction “Input”.


Use case 4: Remove WorkspaceObject from the Verification Request
For each WorkspaceObject, the system deletes the Crt0ValidatoinLink between Verification Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • If the WorkspaceObject contains the measurable attributes, the system un-assigns these attributes from the Verification Request.


Use case 5: Create and add occurrences to the Verification Request
For a given ItemRevision object, the system first creates the occurrence and then creates Crt0ValidationLink between Verification Request (primary) and occurrence (secondary).
    • The new occurrences can either be created as sibling or child for the given parent occurrence


Use case 6: Add top node to context and add to the Verification Reques
For a given ItemRevision object, the system first adds the ItemRevision to context and then add the top node to Verification Request.

Use case 7: Add Interface occurrence to the Verification Request
For each Interface occurrence, the system queries the parent system model occurrence. If the parent system model occurrence is not added to the Verification Request, capture the partical error and continue to proceed the next Interface occurrence.
    • If the Interface contains the Interface Definitions, the system adds each Interface Definitions to the Verification Request.
    • If the diagramAction in ManageVerificationRequestPref is not empty, the system addes the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Verification Request.
    • If the useClosureRule in ManageVerificationRequestPref is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Verification Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Verification Request.


Use case 8: Remove Interface occurrence from the Verification Request
For each Interface occurrence, the system queries the parent system model occurrence. If the parent system model occurrence is not added to the Verification Request, capture the partical error and continue to proceed the next Interface occurrence.
    • If the Interface contains the Interface Definitions, the system removes each Interface Definitions from the Verification Request.
    • If the diagramAction in ManageVerificationRequestPref is not empty, the system adds the given occurrence to the associated diagram data in the Verification Request.
    • If the useClosureRule in ManageVerificationRequestPref is true, the system starts traversing from the given occurrence based on the closure rule defined in the Verification Request, and then add the traversed occurrences to the Verification Request.


Use case 9: Add Interface Definitions on the port to the Verification Request
The system creates the Crt0GDERef to represent the assigned Interface Definition in the Verification Request.
    • If the Interface Definition contains the Meaurable Attributes, the system assigns these Meaurable Attributes to the Verification Request. The default attribute direction needs to align to the Interface Definition direction if set. Otherwise, the parent Port direction.
    • Skip the flag diagramAction
    • Skip the flag useClosureRule


Use case 10: Remove Interface Definitions on the port from the Verification Request
The system deletes the Crt0GDERef which represents the assigned Interface Definition in the Verification Request.
    • If the Interface Definition contains the Meaurable Attributes, the system un-assigns these Meaurable Attributes from the Verification Request.
    • Skip the flag diagramAction in ManageVerificationRequestPref
    • Skip the flag useClosureRule in ManageVerificationRequestPref

ParameterInfo.description: A list of SetAttrDirectionInput structure.

ParameterInfo.description: Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) to be validated

Operation.description:
This operation initiates the validation on the given Analysis Request in the external simulation tool.

The validation status is checked for the given Analysis Request,
If the status equals to “in progress”, this request is skipped and a partial error is returned.
For other status, the validation is done asyncrounously in the extneral simuation tool, updates the validation status is set to “in progress” and then returns.

In the background, validateAnalysisRequestAnyc calls the REST APIs to initiate the validation in the external simulation tool. When the tool completes the validation, the tool would upload the validation result (package) into Teamcenter. Then validateAnalysisRequestAnyc attaches the package to the input Analysis Request and sends a message to notify the users.
Operation.name: validateAnalysisRequest
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
184031 – System could not initiate the validation of Analysis Request as validation is already in progress.
Operation.useCase: Use case 1: User would like to validate the Analysis Request to verify if the Simulation Architecture created is good to proceed with actual simulation.

ParameterInfo.description: Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) to be validated.

Operation.description: This operation is Async operation. It calls the REST APIs to initiate the validation on the given Analysis Request in the external simulation tool. When the tool completes the validation, the validation result (package) is uploaded to Teamcenter. Then this operation attaches the package to the input Analysis Request, updates the validation status (i.e pass/fail) and then sends the message to notify the current user.
Operation.name: validateAnalysisRequestAsync
Operation.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.
Operation.useCase: User would like to validate the Analysis Request to verify if the Simulation Architecture created is good to proceed with actual simulation.

ParameterInfo.description: Analysis Requests (Crt0VldnContractRevision) whose diagram elements must be added for validation/analysis.

Operation.description:
Objects that need to be validated or analyzed must be added to an Analysis Request. This operation adds or updates for validation or analysis purpose, all the objects from the current Architecture Diagram of the input Analysis Request's (Crt0VldnContractRevision) domain.
1. If objects have not been previously added, all the current Architecture Diagram elements are added to the Analysis Request.
2. If objects have been previously added, they are removed and all the current Architecture Diagram elements are added to the Analysis Request.
All the objects that are displayed in the diagram and those that meet the Analysis Request's definition criteria are added to the Analysis Request. This includes any displayed children of any object in the diagram.
If the Analysis Definition contains more than one possible sections that can accept an object, the object will be added to the first possible section.
Operation.name: addObjectsForValidationFromDiagram
Operation.returnDescription:
The successfully updated Analysis Request objects are returned in the Updated list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be retured:

184021 :The object being added to the Analysis Request is not accepted by any section specified in the Analysis Request's definition.
Operation.useCase:
1. Add the Domain's models, requirements, targets, test cases from the Architecture
diagram to the Analysis Request in a simplified manner.
Prior to creating an Analysis Request, specific elements relavant for an analysis or validation are turned ON in the domain, so that they appear on the Architecture Diagram. User selects a one step command in Active Workspace to add or update objects from the Architecture Diagram to the Analysis Request in one go.

DeprecationInfo.deprecatedDescription: this operation does not support adding validation results to Verification Request, please use opertion manageVerificationRequest.

ParameterInfo.description: Information of result objects to be added to Validation Contract

Operation.description:
After a validation activity, results need to be added to Validation Contracts. This operation adds the specified result objects to the Validation Contract. Tracelinks are created for the specified type between the Crt0VldnContractRevision and the specified result objects.
The result objects will be added to sections specified in the "results" group. The sections in the "results" group are specified in the contract definition revision (Crt0VCDefnRevision) that is attached to the validation contract revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision).
Operation.name: addValidationResults
Operation.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
184001: If the The object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request's definition does not have the input section.
184002: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request's definition does not have a section for the object type.
184007: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified Trace Link type is not Crt0ValidationLink.
184014: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the input section defined in the Analysis Request's definition does not accept object type.
184015: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it is already added to it.
184016: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
184017: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is released.
184018: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is checked out by another user.

Operation.returnDescription:
The set of Crt0VldnContractRevision objects with the 'added' state for each Awb0Element. Following partial errors may be returned.
    • 184006: There are no adapters defined for the Awb0Element.

Add a Product's component (Awb0Element) to an Analysis Request. When the same component is again selected for adding to the Analysis Request, a visual indication must be given to the user that it is already added. This can be achieved for example by greying out a command on the client.

ParameterInfo.description: List of CreateARInput objects to create Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision) objects.

Operation.description:
This operation creates an Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract) object. Along with creation of Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract) object, this operation also supports.
-Addition of objects to Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract) for analysis purpose. The
supported types that can be added to Analysis Requests are BOMLine and POMObject.
-Setting Input/Output Measurable Attributes (Att0MeasurableAttribute) on Analysis Request.
Operation.name: createAnalysisRequest
Operation.returnDescription:
The response contains the Analysis Request object created.
The following errors may be returned:
185206 - Please provide a value for the measurable attribute parameter to complete the
"Assign" operation.
185207 - Please provide a value for the parent line parameter to complete the "Assign"
operation.
185208 - The system does not support the "Assign" action on top lines.
Operation.useCase:
1. User already has all the data to create an Analysis Request, therefore user wants to create the
Analysis Request programmatically.
2. User wants to set Input/Output Measurable Attribute (Att0MeasurableAttribute) on the
Analysis Request.
3. User wants to add object to Analysis Request.

The input contains the Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision) or Study (Crt0StudyRevision) and the scope of information that must be retreived.

Operation.description:
This service operation gets information of the input Analysis Requests (Crt0VldnContractRevision) or Study (Crt0StudyRevision), which is a sub type of Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision).

The following information can be retrieved:
a. Input objects (Awb0Element) that are added to Analysis Request.
b. Output objects (WorkspaceObject) that are added to Analysis Request.
c. Input attributes (Att0MeasurableAttribute).
d. Output attributes(Att0MeasurableAttribute).
e. Children studies (Crt0StudyRevision) of an Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision).

Information about the input Analysis Request is returned. The amount of information retrieved depends on the scope specified in the input to the operation.

The Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContractRevision), Studies (Crt0StudyRevision), Input Objects (Awb0Element), Output Objects (WorkspaceObject) and Attributes (Att0MeasuableAttribute) will be added to the plain objects list of the Service Data in the response..

The following partial errors may be returned:
184024 : The Analysis Request mapping file in dataset is invalid, because either the XML contains a syntax error or it does not confirm to the Analysis Request mapping schema (which can be found in the dataset AnalysisRequestMappingSchema).
184025 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the input scope, is not supported.
184026 : The children studies information of Analysis Request cannot be retrieved, because the input children studies scope, is not supported.
184027 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the XSD schema dataset of the mapping file is not found.
184028 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the name of mapping dataset to be used, was not specified. The Analysis Request mapping preference does not exist or does not contain a value.
184029 : The information of Analysis Request or Study cannot be retrieved, because the mapping dataset is not found.

OperationParameter.description: A list of AddElementsToARInput structure.
OperationParameter.name: inputs

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation adds specified objects that need to be validated to the Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract). Trace Links of the specified type are created between the Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) and the specified Components to be validated.

Trace Link creation rules are mentioned below:

1. If a Component (Awb0Element) and the Context are specified, in-context Trace Link is created.
2. If a Component (Awb0Element) is specified but the Context is not specified, the Item Revision corresponding to the Component is used to create the Trace Link.
OperationTemplate.name: Crt1::Soa::ValidationContractAW::VCManagement::addElementsToAnalysisRequest
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned in the ServiceData:
188009: The Analysis Request Package is invalid, because the specified quantity is invalid for the Teamcenter business object.
188011: The object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it has already been added to it.
188016: The object cannot be added to the Analysis Reques, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.

OperationParameter.description: This structure contains all information required to add objects to Validation Contract.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
Objects that need to be validated must be added to Validation Contracts. This operation adds specified objects that need to be validated to the Valiation Contract. It does this by creating tracelinks of the specified type between the Validation Contract Revision and the specified Components to be validated.
Tracelink creation rules are mentioned below:

1.    If a Component (Awb0Element) and the Context are specified, in-context tracelink is created.
2.    If a Component (Awb0Element) is specified but the Context is not specified, the Item Revision corresponding to the Component is used to created the tracelink.

The objects will be added to sections specified in the "view" group. The sections in the "view" group are specified in the Contract Definition that is attached to the Validation Contract.
OperationTemplate.name: Crt1::Soa::ValidationContractAW::VCManagement::addObjectsForValidation
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned in the ServiceData:
35003: If the input Trace Link type is invalid.
35006: If the input Validation Contract is invalid.
35007: If the input object to the added to the Validaiton Contract is invalid.
184007: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified Trace Link type is not (Crt0ValidationLink).
184008: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the section name is empty.
184009: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the component and the context are the same.
184010: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the context of the component does not belong to the Analysis Request's domain.
184011: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it exceeds the quantity of allowed objects for the specified section. The quantity of objects allowed for the section is specified in the Analysis definition.
184012: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified section does not exist in the Analysis definition.
184015: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it is already added to it.
184016: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
184017: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is released.
184018: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is checked out by another user.

OperationParameter.description: Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) to be validated
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description:
This operation initiates the validation on the given Analysis Request in the external simulation tool.

The validation status is checked for the given Analysis Request,
If the status equals to “in progress”, this request is skipped and a partial error is returned.
For other status, the validation is done asyncrounously in the extneral simuation tool, updates the validation status is set to “in progress” and then returns.

In the background, validateAnalysisRequestAnyc calls the REST APIs to initiate the validation in the external simulation tool. When the tool completes the validation, the tool would upload the validation result (package) into Teamcenter. Then validateAnalysisRequestAnyc attaches the package to the input Analysis Request and sends a message to notify the users.
OperationTemplate.name: Crt1::Soa::ValidationContractAW::VCManagement::validateAnalysisRequest
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The following partial errors may be returned:
184031 – System could not initiate the validation of Analysis Request as validation is already in progress.

OperationParameter.description: Analysis Request Revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision) to be validated.
OperationParameter.name: input

OperationTemplate.description: This operation is Async operation. It calls the REST APIs to initiate the validation on the given Analysis Request in the external simulation tool. When the tool completes the validation, the validation result (package) is uploaded to Teamcenter. Then this operation attaches the package to the input Analysis Request, updates the validation status (i.e pass/fail) and then sends the message to notify the current user.
OperationTemplate.name: Crt1::Soa::ValidationContractAW::VCManagement::validateAnalysisRequestAsync
OperationTemplate.returnDescription: This is an asynchronous method, there is no return value.

OperationTemplate.description:
Objects that need to be validated or analyzed must be added to an Analysis Request. This operation adds or updates for validation or analysis purpose, all the objects from the current Architecture Diagram of the input Analysis Request's (Crt0VldnContractRevision) domain.
1. If objects have not been previously added, all the current Architecture Diagram elements are added to the Analysis Request.
2. If objects have been previously added, they are removed and all the current Architecture Diagram elements are added to the Analysis Request.
All the objects that are displayed in the diagram and those that meet the Analysis Request's definition criteria are added to the Analysis Request. This includes any displayed children of any object in the diagram.
If the Analysis Definition contains more than one possible sections that can accept an object, the object will be added to the first possible section.
OperationTemplate.name: Crt1::Soa::ValidationContractAW::VCManagement::addObjectsForValidationFromDiagram
OperationTemplate.returnDescription:
The successfully updated Analysis Request objects are returned in the Updated list of the ServiceData. The following partial errors may be retured:

184021 :The object being added to the Analysis Request is not accepted by any section specified in the Analysis Request's definition.

After a validation activity, results need to be added to Validation Contracts. This operation adds the specified result objects to the Validation Contract. Tracelinks are created for the specified type between the Crt0VldnContractRevision and the specified result objects.
The result objects will be added to sections specified in the "results" group. The sections in the "results" group are specified in the contract definition revision (Crt0VCDefnRevision) that is attached to the validation contract revision (Crt0VldnContractRevision).

OperationTemplate.returnDescription:

184001: If the The object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request's definition does not have the input section.
184002: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request's definition does not have a section for the object type.
184007: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the specified Trace Link type is not Crt0ValidationLink.
184014: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the input section defined in the Analysis Request's definition does not accept object type.
184015: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because it is already added to it.
184016: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the current user does not have write privileges to the Analysis Request.
184017: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is released.
184018: If the object cannot be added to the Analysis Request, because the Analysis Request is checked out by another user.

StructElement.description: Name value pair (BusinessObject/ConfigInfo) of configuration for the BOM if domain property points to top level Item of the BOM. The key is top level Item of the BOM specified in the domain property and value is the confirmation for the BOM, for example, [“RevisionRule”, “LatestWorking”].This is an option property if domain is Awb0SavedBookmark.
StructElement.name: configuration

StructElement.description: The type of the Analysis Request (Crt0VldnContract) to be created. If no type is specified then default type Crt0VldnContract will be used to create the Analysis Request.
StructElement.name: analysisRequestType

StructElement.name: analaysisRequestDefinition

StructElement.description: Either the Awb0SavedBookmark or top level Items in the BOM. This is an optional property.
StructElement.name: domain

StructElement.description:
Name value pair (string/list of strings) of additional properties to be set on Analysis Request at the time of creation. Key is property name and value is the value of the property to be set on the
Analysis Request. Please note that the properties present in additionalProps must be part of AnalysisRequestCreateDescriptor to be set on Analysis Request.
StructElement.name: additionalProps

StructElement.description: All the objects that needs to be added to the Analysis Request.
StructElement.name: objectsForAnalysisRequest

StructElement.description: Information for the Attributes to be added as Input.
StructElement.name: inputAttributes

StructElement.description: Information for the Attributes to be added as Output.
StructElement.name: outputAttributes

StructElement.description: Name of the recipe to apply on the seed elements. If value of ‘recipe’ is provided then all the objects after applying the closure rule will be added to Analysis Request.
StructElement.name: recipe

StructElement.description:
Action that are to be taken on diagram associated with the product.
Valid values are:
update: Existing diagram will be updated with any extra objects present in the
Analysis Request which are not available on the diagram.
create: Any existing diagram will be removed and a new diagram will be created from the
objects present in the Analysis Request.
Empty String: No action will be taken on diagram.
StructElement.name: diagramAction

StructElement.description:
The Component (Awb0Element) that is to be validated.
If the portToInterfaceDefsMap is not empty, this field represents the parent occurrence of Port.
If the portToInterfaceDefsMap is empty, this field represents the occurrence to add to the Analysis Request or remove from Analysis Request. If this field is a Port occurrence, the system should add/remove all Interface Definitions on this Port to/from the Analysis Request.

StructElement.description:
Action that are to be taken for objectToAdd. This is valid only for manageAction “addToBom”.
Supported values are:
“Child”: The objectToAdd will be added as a child to objectToAddParent and will be added to Verification Request.
“Sibling”: The objectToAdd will be added as a sibling to objectToAddParent and will be added to Verification Request.

StructElement.description:
Action that are to be taken against the given Verification Request.
Valid values are:
    • “addObject”: Add object to the given Verification Request.
    • “removeObject”: Remove object from the given Verification Request.
    • “addToBOM”: Add object to BOM and then add object to the given Verification Request.
    • “removeFromBOM”: Remove object from BOM and then remove object from the given Verification Request.
    • “addToContext”: Add object to context and then add object to the given Verification Request.
    • “removeFromContext”: Remove object from context and then remove object from the given Verification Request.
    • “addFromRecipe”: Run the recipe on given seed objects and add results to Verificaiton Request.
    • “addInterface”: Add interfaces to the given Verification Request.
    • “removeInterface”: Remove interfaces from the given Verification Request.
    • “addInterfaceDef”: Add Interface Definitions to the given Verification Request.
    • “removeInterfaceDef”: Remove Interface Defintions from the given Verification Request.

StructElement.description: The object for which result is calculated. Supported types are Crt0VldnContractRevision or Crt1VRContentProxy.
StructElement.name: contentObject

StructElement.description:
The output of the testing done on content of Crt0VldnContractRevision. Valid values are: “Pass”, “Fail” and “No Results”.
Pass: Test is performed on content and test is passed.
Fail: Test is performed on content and test is failed.
No Results: Test is not yet performed on content.
StructElement.name: result

StructElement.description:
String representing more information about the results property value. Overridden and Rollup are valid values.
Overridden: When result is overridden by user.
Rollup: When result is calculated based on rollup results of content.
StructElement.name: resultInfo

StructElement.name: clientID

StructElement.description: The Crt0VldnContractRevision or Crt0StudyRevision or Crt0RunRevision object whose information to retrieve.
StructElement.name: verificationRequestRevision

StructElement.description:
The scope of Verification Request information that must be retrieved. Valid values are “” (Empty), “Study”, “Run”.
    • Empty to retrieve associated data of Verification Request only.
    • “Study” to retrieve Study information of Verification Request.
    • “Run” to retrieve Run information of Verification Request.
StructElement.name: outputScope

StructElement.description:
The scope of Parameters (Att0MeasurableAttribute) information that must be retrieved. Valid values are “” (Empty), “Input”, “Output”.
    • Empty to retrieve all parameters associated with verificationRequestRevision for verification purpose.
    • “Input” to retrieve all input parameters associated with verificationRequestRevision for verification purpose.
    • “Output” to retrieve all output parameters associated with verificationRequestRevision for verification purpose.
StructElement.name: parameterScope

StructElement.description:
A comma seprated list of options in key:value format, to return additional data associated with verificationRequest.
Valid values are:
    • "process_tracelinks:true". Populates TracelinkData associated with verificationRequest
    • "process_tracelinks:false". To not process TracelinkData
    • "process_interface_definitions:true". Populates interfaceDefinitionData associated with verificationRequest contents.
    • "process_interface_definitions:false". To not process interfaceDefinitionData
    • "process_product_type:BOMLine". To return ProductData as BOMLine type associated with verificationRequest.
    • "process_product_type:Awb0Element". To return ProductData as Awb0Element type associated with verificationRequest.
    • or combination of above with comma separated delimiter.

If empty, processes no additional data.
StructElement.name: includeConfigurationInformation
